entry.summary: Best practices and guidelines to improve the UX of infinite scroll with bookmarks, footer reveal and pagination.

entry.title: SmashingConf Is Back In 2022
entry.summary: After two years when almost everything moved online, 2022 marks the return of in-person conferences. In fact, [SmashingConf is back](https://smashingconf.com/conferences): coming to San Francisco and Austin in June, Freiburg (Germany) in September, and New York in October.

entry.summary: Are you a designer or developer affected by the war in Ukraine? Here are some options to consider if you‚Äôre looking for a design or tech job.

entry.title: 6 Useful Bookmarklets to Boost Web Development
entry.summary: A bookmarklet is a JavaScript-based bookmark that adds to a web browser. I‚Äôd like to show you some awesome web browser hacks to aid your web development workflow and how to convert those hacks into time-saving bookmarklets. Activating design mode ‚Ä¶ 6 Useful Bookmarklets to Boost Web Development originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: A Guide To Hover And Pointer Media Queries
entry.summary: In this article, we‚Äôll talk about how to adapt our sites to the different scenarios of a device pointer: whether it has a pointer or not, or how accurate it is. To adapt our site to those devices‚Äô needs we‚Äôll talk about how to properly use media queries `hover`, `pointer`, `any-hover` and `any-pointer`.

entry.title: Remix Routes Demystified
entry.summary: In the past months, there have been lots of talks dedictaed to Remix. Routing is not only one of the things that sets it apart from other frameworks, but it also fuels great performance and improves the overall experience for developers. Let‚Äôs dig in to all of the features that build up routing in this powerful framework.

entry.title: Those HTML Attributes You Never Use
entry.summary: In this article, Louis Lazaris describes and demonstrates some interesting HTML attributes that you may or may not have heard of and perhaps find useful enough to personally use in one of your projects.

entry.title: Good Design Is All About Good Timing
entry.summary: In this shorter series of articles, we highlight design patterns, techniques, and strategies to design better digital interfaces. You can also learn much more in [‚ÄúSmart Interface Design Patterns‚Äù](https://smart-interface-design-patterns.com/), a 6h-video course with 100s of hand-picked examples, curated by Vitaly.

entry.title: Write HTML, the HTML Way (Not the XHTML Way)
entry.summary: You may not use XHTML (anymore), but when you write HTML, you may be more influenced by XHTML than you think. You are very likely writing HTML, the XHTML way. What is the XHTML way of writing HTML, and what ‚Ä¶ Write HTML, the HTML Way (Not the XHTML Way) originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: Windows High Contrast Mode, Forced Colors Mode And CSS Custom Properties
entry.summary: CSS Custom Properties can be used for far more than just color, and their values update in realtime, both via display mode updates and JavaScript logic. This is powerful stuff. Eric explains how modern CSS is a powerful piece of assistive technology that can thread into it to create flexible, maintainable and adaptive digital experiences.

entry.title: Optimizing SVG Patterns to Their Smallest Size

To fit this constraint, I have ‚Ä¶ Optimizing SVG Patterns to Their Smallest Size originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: How To Make A Drag-and-Drop File Uploader With Vue.js 3
entry.summary: Building on a previous article on How to Build a Drag-and-Drop File Uploader, we‚Äôll be adding some new features, but more importantly (maybe), we‚Äôll be learning how to build it in Vue 3 and learn some best practices for Vue along the way.

entry.title: Claymorphism: Will It Stick Around?
entry.summary: This fresh new design trend has been picking up steam with the rising popularity of colorful inflated 3D graphics in web illustrations and with the latest Virtual Reality projects like ‚ÄúHorizon Worlds‚Äù. Let‚Äôs see if there is room for Claymorphism on the UI, and how we can create this effect with CSS.
